original_solution_mapping.L1: Dana has 15 more pencils than Jayden who has 20, so Dana has 20+15 = <<20+15=35>>35 pencils
original_solution_mapping.L2: Jayden has 20 pencils which is twice as much as Marcus's so Marcus has 20/2 = <<20/2=10>>10 pencils
original_solution_mapping.L3: Dana has 35-10 = <<35-10=25>>25 more pencils than Marcus

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4666.
    Returns: the difference in the number of pencils Dana has compared to Marcus.
    """
    # L1
    dana_more_than_jayden = 15 # Dana has 15 more pencils than Jayden
    jayden_pencils = 20 # Jayden has 20 pencils
    dana_pencils = jayden_pencils + dana_more_than_jayden

    # L2
    twice_factor = 2 # twice as much as Marcus
    marcus_pencils = jayden_pencils / twice_factor

    # L3
    difference_dana_marcus = dana_pencils - marcus_pencils

    # FA
    answer = difference_dana_marcus
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Dana has {dana_more_than_jayden} more pencils than Jayden who has {jayden_pencils}, so Dana has {jayden_pencils}+{dana_more_than_jayden} = <<{jayden_pencils}+{dana_more_than_jayden}={dana_pencils}>>{dana_pencils} pencils
Jayden has {jayden_pencils} pencils which is twice as much as Marcus's so Marcus has {jayden_pencils}/{twice_factor} = <<{jayden_pencils}/{twice_factor}={marcus_pencils}>>{marcus_pencils} pencils
Dana has {dana_pencils}-{marcus_pencils} = <<{dana_pencils}-{marcus_pencils}={difference_dana_marcus}>>{difference_dana_marcus} more pencils than Marcus

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Dana has 15 more pencils than Jayden who has 15, so Dana has 15+15 = <<15+15=30>>30 pencils
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Jayden has 20 pencils which is twice as much as Marcus's so Marcus has 20/2 = <<20/2=10>>10 pencils
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Dana has 30-10 = <<30-10=20>>20 more pencils than Marcus

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'dana_more_than_jayden' (15) was used instead of 'jayden_pencils' (20).
